column4: sound on intrepid has me frustrated as all getout. I installed on three computers in the house, only one that doesn't have a sound problem is the laptop.
is there and easy way to disable onboard sound if you have a sound card?
yeah, change device double clicking volume control choose preferences, choose souncard. you should get and run asoundconf and set default soundcard also.
ok, top two entries were the two sound devices, then a long list of each one in alsa, etc... now do asoundconf?
i mean after choosing
asoundconf-gtk package
thanks, apting now
selected the sound card, what now?
that's it?
go into system - preferences - sound and set the device there too, you probably need to play with it
ok, thanks
choose alsa by the way
sounds great, watching a thing on miro right now. thanks for your help
glad it worked, good job, youre welcome
err, still having some trouble
running intrepid?
install alsamixer set everything. check system -prefs -sound play with settings. pulseaudio is a pain.
should i remove pulseaudio?
i purged pulse and installed esound.
with onboard sound and a soundcard you've got to experiment
i'm on hardy at the moment.
dtchen looks like i have it already, ok
